comment:
* A tab has a tab indicator, content, and a tag that is used to keep
     * track of it.  This builder helps choose among these options.
     *
     * For the tab indicator, your choices are:
     * 1) set a label
     * 2) set a label and an icon
     *
     * For the tab content, your choices are:
     * 1) the id of a {@link View}
     * 2) a {@link TabContentFactory} that creates the {@link View} content.
     * 3) an {@link Intent} that launches an {@link android.app.Activity}.

methods.name: public TabSpec setIndicator(CharSequence label)
methods.comment: * Specify a label as the tab indicator.

methods.name: public TabSpec setIndicator(CharSequence label, Drawable icon)
methods.comment: * Specify a label and icon as the tab indicator.

methods.name: public TabSpec setIndicator(View view)
methods.comment: * Specify a view as the tab indicator.

methods.name: public TabSpec setContent(int viewId)
methods.comment:
* Specify the id of the view that should be used as the content
         * of the tab.

methods.name: public TabSpec setContent(TabContentFactory contentFactory)
methods.comment:
* Specify a {@link android.widget.TabHost.TabContentFactory} to use to
         * create the content of the tab.

methods.name: public TabSpec setContent(Intent intent)
methods.comment: * Specify an intent to use to launch an activity as the tab content.

methods.name: public String getTag()
methods.comment:
* Returns the tag for this tab specification.
         *
         * @return the tag for this tab specification

methodNames: public TabSpec setIndicator(CharSequence label, Drawable icon)
